selector.cur module¶

selector.cur.boltz_selection(boltz: float, props: ~typing.List[float], input_indices: ~typing.List[int], num_minima: int, rng=<module 'numpy.random' from '/Users/jyxu/miniconda3/envs/aiida/lib/python3.7/site-packages/numpy/random/__init__.py'>)¶

Selected indices based on Boltzmann distribution.

References: [1] Bernstein, N.; Csányi, G.; Deringer, V. L.

De Novo Exploration and Self-Guided Learning of Potential-Energy Surfaces. npj Comput. Mater. 2019, 5, 99.

selector.cur.cur_selection(features, num: int, zeta: float = 2, strategy: str = 'descent', rng=<module 'numpy.random' from '/Users/jyxu/miniconda3/envs/aiida/lib/python3.7/site-packages/numpy/random/__init__.py'>)¶

Performa a CUR selection.

Parameters

  • features – A (nframes,nfeatures) shaped arrray.

  • num – Selected number.

  • zeta – Exponential coefficient.

  • strategy – Selection strategy, either stochastic or descent.

  • rng – Random generator.

References

[1] Bernstein, N.; Csányi, G.; Deringer, V. L.

De Novo Exploration and Self-Guided Learning of Potential-Energy Surfaces. npj Comput. Mater. 2019, 5, 99.

[2] Mahoney, M. W.; Drineas, P.

CUR Matrix Decompositions for Improved Data Analysis. Proc. Natl. Acad. Sci. USA 2009, 106, 697–702.

selector.cur.descriptor_svd(at_descs, num: int, do_vectors='vh')¶

Perfrom a sparse SVD.

selector.cur.fps_selection(features, num: int, min_distance=0.1, metric='euclidean', metric_params={}, rng=<module 'numpy.random' from '/Users/jyxu/miniconda3/envs/aiida/lib/python3.7/site-packages/numpy/random/__init__.py'>)¶

Farthest point sampling on vector-based features.

Reference:

https://github.com/bigd4/PyNEP.git

selector.cur.hist_selection(nbins: int, pmin: float, pmax: float, props: ~typing.List[float], input_indices: ~typing.List[int], num_minima: int, rng=<module 'numpy.random' from '/Users/jyxu/miniconda3/envs/aiida/lib/python3.7/site-packages/numpy/random/__init__.py'>)¶

selector.graph.single_create_structure_graph(atoms: Atoms, graph_params: dict, group_commands: Optional[List[str]] = None) → List[Graph]¶

Create structure graph and get selected chemical environments.

Find atoms with selected chemical symbols or in the defined region.

Parameters

  • graph_params – Parameters for the graph representation.

  • spec_params – Selected criteria.

  • atoms – Input structure.

Returns

A list of graphs that represent the chemical environments of selected atoms.

Bases: Variable

selector.interface.create_selector(input_list: List[dict], directory: Union[str, Path] = PosixPath('/Users/jyxu/Documents/SomeCodes/GDPy/docs'), pot_worker: Optional[AbstractWorker] = None) → AbstractSelector¶

Create a selector based on arguments.

Parameters

  • input_list – A list of each selector’s parameters.

  • directory – Working directory.

  • pot_worker – A worker for potential computations.

Returns

An instance of the AbstractSelector.

selector.property module¶

class selector.property.PropertyBasedSelector(directory='./', *args, **kwargs)¶

Bases: AbstractSelector

Select structures based on structural properties.

Each structure (trajectory) is represented by a float property.

default_parameters: dict = {'number': [4, 0.2], 'properties': [], 'worker': None}¶

Default parameters.

name: str = 'property'¶

Selector name.

class selector.property.PropertyItem(name: str, metric: Union[str, List[str]] = None, sparsify: str = 'filter', trajwise: bool = False, reverse: bool = False, range: List[float] = <factory>, nbins: int = 20, kBT: float = None)¶

Bases: object

kBT: float = None¶

Boltzmann temperature (eV).

metric: Union[str, List[str]] = None¶

metric config…

name: str¶

Property name that can be found in atoms.info or atoms.arrays.

nbins: int = 20¶

Number of bins for histogram-based sparsification.

pmax: float = inf¶
pmin: float = -inf¶
range: List[float]¶
reverse: bool = False¶

Whether reverse the sparsifiction behaviour.

sparsify: str = 'filter'¶

Sparsifiction method. [filter, sort, hist, boltz]

trajwise: bool = False¶

Whether perform sparsifiction on each traj separately.

selector.selector module¶

class selector.selector.AbstractSelector(directory=PosixPath('/Users/jyxu/Documents/SomeCodes/GDPy/docs'), *args, **kwargs)¶

Bases: AbstractNode

The base class of any selector.

attach_worker(worker=None) → NoReturn¶

Attach a worker to this node.

default_parameters: dict = {'number': [4, 0.2]}¶

Default parameters.

property directory: Path¶

Working directory.

Note

When setting directory, some additional files are re-directed.

property fname¶
indent: int = 0¶

Indent of outputs.

logger = None¶

Logger instance.

name: str = 'abstract'¶

Selector name.

njobs¶

Number of parallel jobs for joblib.

pfunc(content, *args, **kwargs)¶

Write outputs to file.

prefix: str = 'selection'¶

Distinguish structures when using ComposedSelector.

select(inp_dat: Union[List[Atoms], List[List[Atoms]]], index_map: Optional[List[int]] = None, ret_indices: bool = False, *args, **kargs) → Union[List[Atoms], List[int]]¶

Select frames or trajectories.

Based on used selction protocol

Parameters

  • frames – A list of ase.Atoms or a list of List[ase.Atoms].

  • index_map – Global indices of frames.

  • ret_indices – Whether return selected indices or frames.

  • *args – Variable length argument list.

  • **kwargs – Arbitrary keyword arguments.

Returns

selected results

Return type

List[Atoms] or List[int]

worker: DriverBasedWorker = None¶

A worker for potential computations.
